title: Christening
description: During Jim and Pam's daughter's christening, Michael becomes upset over the lack of family-like unity between himself and his employees. So he responds by impulsively joining a teenage church mission to Mexico.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know a lot of us have been feeling under the weather lately. It's that time of year. And according to a study done by the University of Arizona, they've discovered that your keyboards have hundreds of times more bacteria, per square inch, than a toilet seat.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I heard your momma had more bacteria per square inch than a toilet seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's true, that's true. I dated her momma, and you know what-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] Um... kay. Uh, alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One of the simplest ways to cut down on the spread of germs is to use something called the vampire cough.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Di-Did you say vampire?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, it's just that if a vampire had to cough, he would do it like this. [coughs into elbow]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh-huh. Right. And ruin their cloaks? Do you have any idea how expensive wool is in Transylvania? [looks at camera] 'Cause of the euro.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, other things you can do to help cut down on the spread of disease are to wash your hands regularly. Don't come in if you're sick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [rolls his eyes and shakes his head] Uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And get your flu shot. Also, I'm going to set up hand sanitizing stations around the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: NO, no, no. They will cost you your life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Elaborate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The worst thing you can do for your immune system is to coddle it. They need to fight their own battles. If Sabre really cared about our well-being, they would set up hand de-sanitizing stations. A simple bowl at every juncture filled with dirt, vomit, fecal matter...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not - I'm not going to do that. I'm not going to do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exposing yourself to germs is the best way to make yourself stronger.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So by that rationale, if I had to sneeze, I should just sneeze on you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I would welcome it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sneezes on Dwight, looks at camera] You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The principle is sound. To avoid illness, expose yourself to germs, enabling your immune system to develop antibodies. I don't know why everyone doesn't do this. Maybe they have something against living forever.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jim. Pam. [gasps, speaks in baby voice] And the precious bundle of God's gift to everything. [back to her normal voice] I wish you both a pleasant day. [baby voice] And you too. Yes. Praise God. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cece's getting christened today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Big day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Everyone from work is here. We weren't planning on that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Top of the Sunday morning to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And a top of the day to you too, sir.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hope you brought your pipes. We're about to smoke the opium of the masses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yes. [mimicking smoking] Doobie-doobie doo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I invited everyone in the office because it's not a day for just Jim or Pam or the baby or me. It is about us all. And I thought we should all celebrate... my joy. And our, all of ours joys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [looking at Cece, under his breath] Ah, man. [looks at Erin talking to Gabe]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Does the Nard-dog want Nard-pups? Yeah. I want a big ol' litter of Nard-pups. All jumping around, sucking on the teet. Put 'em in a box, give 'em to my neighbors. Yeah, I want kids.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [handing out cards] For all your paper and printer needs. For all your paper and printer needs. For all your paper and printer needs.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sunday church service... it's been a few years. The Big Guy and I, we got some catching up to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in an old man mobster voice] Hey. Hey. I got an offer that you can't refuse. Scooch over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, this is just for family.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I'm the Godfather.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is really funny, but you know that can be confusing at a christening because you are not the godfather.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you talking to me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispers to Pam] Ok, your turn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Scooch. Before I shoot you in the head.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, Michael. Um, you know I love when you do that voice, but today, I'm so sorry. I need you to tell me that you know you're not Cece's godfather.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry, Michael. I need you to say it. I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [normal voice] I'm not the godfather.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears his throat] So who is the godfather?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Our friend, Seth, and his wife there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Old friend, like, you've known him since kindergarten?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I met his wife in Mommy and Me. They're a great couple. You should meet them later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I have plenty of friends, so... all right, well, you have great seats. Enjoy the show.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Thank you for coming, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't even know how to say this, but Cece is turning out to be a little b-i-t-c-h. And that's not true, but her parents are kind of boxing me out.

quotes.speaker: Church Congregation
quotes.text: [singing] We ask you, Lord, come to our aid.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: What a terrific day this is, and not just because the Eagles are playing. [laughter, Kevin giggles]

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: You may have seen the bus out front. Today we also say good-bye to our young adult ministry. They're leaving for three months to build a school for the village of Quimixto, in Cabo Corrientes, Mexico.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I've heard of that place. If you go to Cabo San Lucas, all the prostitutes are from Cabo Corrientes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [stands outside church entrance] Okay, this is, all right, this is silly. [goes inside] [walks back out] Nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope, nope...

quotes.speaker: Female Church Member
quotes.text: And thank you for your prayers for Justin. We hope for a speedy recovery.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: Thank you. Anyone else with a prayer or a remembrance? [Dwight and an eldery man stand up at the same time, Dwight stares at him, man sits back down]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning. Dwight Schrute. Thank you all for your prayers and your remembrances. Like Justin and his disfigurement, I too have had a horrible year. They say that the middle class is disappearing, and with it, the soul of America. So, as a gift to this beautiful congregation, I would like to offer a 4% discount on all Dunder Mifflin Sabre products if you buy a printer at full price.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: Christening calls to repentance, to faithfulness, and to discipleship. We've come to celebrate these babies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking at Cece's diaper] Somebody needs a change.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, she can't bring this up with her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. All right, come on. [picks up Cece from Pam, whispers to her] Where are we going? Where are we going? We're gonna take a little field trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispering, going into the bathroom with Cece] Okay. Okay. There's my girl. All right. Hold on one second. There we go. What's that face for? Oh, my-oh, my God. Cece, no. No, no, no, not on the dress! Cece, stop!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [seeing Jim come in with Cece wearing an old t-shirt] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Honey, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is happening.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have an extra outfit in the bag.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. There's no extra outfit in the bag.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You said you checked it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I did... say that.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: At this time, will the families please come join me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim and Pam and Cece really seem to be clicking. They are totally gelling. It's as if they leave my office and they go to another office that sells happiness. And good for them. That's great, because, you know, the paper industry's not gonna last forever.

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: Before we go, I'd like to remind everyone that the "Halberts" have been kind enough to host a reception next door immediately following the service.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm. No. Wrong on both counts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, "A," Halbert. And, "B," I think a more appropriate statement would be, "The 'Halberts' are hosting an intimate reception for their invited guests."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: For all their generosity of spirit, they password-protect their wireless?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Try "Jesus."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Opus dei.

quotes.speaker: Male Church Member
quotes.text: [to Michael] Hi. Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Female Church Member
quotes.text: [to Michael] Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shh, shh, shh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking around and greeting people] How are you? Good morning. Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am feeling this. Call it the Holy Spirit or the passion of the Christ. I am loving these people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: I'm Doug Mcpherson, Davey's uncle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, well, Dave is an adorable baby.

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: Davey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [Doug walks away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, this is intimate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We just had to add a few more tables. We weren't expecting this many people.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don't know them all?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope, and we're gonna need a loaves and fishes kind of miracle to feed 'em all.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jesus is not your caterer. [baby voice to Cece] But he should be your caterer 'cause you're a little angel. Why didn't your parents get you a caterer? [normal voice] They don't think.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Cece] Hm. Don't listen to her. She's just jealous 'cause she doesn't get to come home to someone as cute as you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh, you think she is jealous about having a baby?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know. I'm just hungry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, well, you know what? Everybody's hungry. [Pam looks at Jim] Sorry. I think I'm just hungry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, after you.

quotes.speaker: Male Church Member
quotes.text: Oh, no, after you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I insist. After me.

quotes.speaker: Male Church Member
quotes.text: [laughs] I'm gonna use that one. Have a good lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. You too.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This is not the meal I was promised. I'm going to have no energy for the rest of the day.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I cancelled my plans to come to this thing, and they repay me with this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, guys, let's just enjoy lunch.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: With what? How? Sometimes, Michael. Sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone, on behalf of the youth ministry that's leaving for Mexico, I just wanted to thank our hosts and tell you about those good-looking guys and gals over there. [group of young adults cheer and applaud]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [whispering] Teach for America girls are way hotter, but they're nuts.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: This is Jessica Ortega. I met her when both she and I were both seven years old when my parents took me to Quimixto on a service trip.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [chuckling] Who takes a kid to Mexico?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I would run to Mexico if that's where the sandwiches are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Right now, Jessica's children have to walk twelve miles to a school with dirt floors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: It's gonna be three months of hard work and when we're done, we'll practically be Quimixtanos.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Greg, hello, it's Dwight from the vestibule. You want to know my eleventh commandment? I will not be undersold.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [overhearing Dwight's conversation] Hey, Dwight. Dwight, hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am ready to love thy neighbor with these kind of discounts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me? Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll call you back.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: My parents explained it to me this way. You wouldn't hesitate to save a family member from a burning building, but what if the earth was your building and all the people on it were your family?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if the moon was your car and Jupiter was your hair brush?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Thank you. Or should I say gracias?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Cece went down.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: [holding up an empty serving dish] What was this? You're out of it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Scones.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: I didn't get one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, if it makes you feel better, I didn't get one either.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Is it just the one jug of apple cider? [Pam shrugs, woman walks away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who the heck was that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think that was sconesy cider, noted baptism reception critic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need more food. I'll go get some subs and sodas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. And cider.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pointing to group of young adults laughing] Look at that. Look at that. That's fun. We need to do stuff together outside of work. Let's go help Africa. Let's go build an airport. We'll start small. We'll have a car wash. We'll send some cheerleaders to regionals.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You could feed the hungry. Us.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why do we have to do something together? I volunteer at a clinic on my own time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, that's just a pick-up scene. Okay, we don't have to volunteer. But I think we should hang out more together.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We are hanging out-right now. You want some more of this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at these people. These are church-going people. And they know how to party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Church isn't a party, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's, it's-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Welcome to the party. Everybody have their kool-aid?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Okay, you know what? This is inappropriate. What is wrong with you guys? What is wrong with you? What is so horrible about wanting to get together and do something nice? Why did you guys even come today? What's so great about your lives that you think you're better than everybody else? That you can make fun of everybody else? You're mean. You're mean girls. Like the movie, Mean Girls. And Kevin and Stanley, if you don't stop worrying so much about what you're gonna put in your gullet, you're gonna die in about a month.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Mee-Maw, would you watch Cece for a second? Don't worry. She's asleep. I'm just gonna track down some more chairs.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: Fine, fine. I guess I'll watch Suzanne's purse and your baby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing in a line saying goodbye to the kids going to Mexico] Bye. Good luck. Good luck to you. Bye. Do good. Do good. Bye. Have fun. We're proud of you. [starts to walk down through the line and into the bus] Bye. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the bus] Hey. Hey. Is this the bus to Mexico?

quotes.speaker: Students
quotes.text: Yeah! [cheers, applause]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in reference to the team shirts] I'll take a shirt.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Are you coming?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you'll have me, yes.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Heck, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? [cheers, applause] Thank you. All right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [seeing Michael on the bus] Michael. Get off the bus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm not. I'm staying on the bus. I'm already on the bus. I'm going.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Michael, this is irresponsible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not irresponsible! I have never been more confident about a decision in my life.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I agree. I think it's superb.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, you have a job to do. Okay, there is no off-season when it comes to printer sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, my job will be here when I get back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, you can't go to Mexico. You don't have your passport.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: [sticking his head out Michael's window on the bus] You don't need one to get in. Plus, we can just have it sent to him down in Mexico.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, right?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, what am I supposed to tell my clients if they ask about you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell them that I died, and I turned into an angel, and when they feel a breeze in a room with all the windows closed or that-that chill on the back of their neck, that is just me watching over them.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay, but what about the bigger corporate accounts?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell them that I'm in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, I'm just about to close a sale. Can I authorize a 15% discount?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you may not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gah!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think it's really cool, Michael. I wish I had a job that I could just leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [looking at Erin] Save me an aisle seat, Michael! I'm coming!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I will not stand idly by while these Mexican villagers are sick.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: We're actually building them a school.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whatever. I won't-I won't stand for it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [waving goodbye as the bus drives away] See you in a few months.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: If the whole world were like you guys, we wouldn't have so many problems.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm. That's not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're one in a million.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: I know. Nobody I know would leave their jobs and friends and families to do manual labor for three months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what, everybody thinks that I am crazy, and that tells me that I am the sanest person I know. So...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just a heads up. Probably gonna be borrowing a few things. Uh, gonna need a contact lens case, some sunscreen, some sandals...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [standing in the church sanctuary, talking to the stained glass] Why you always got to be so mean to me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [seeing Cece gone from the couch he left her] Uh, MeeMaw, where's Cece?

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: I don't know. I lost the purse too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good-bye, Lackawana County.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How long till we get to Mexico?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, two days minus how long we've been on the road. 45 minutes? So, like, two days basically. Maybe more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ooh. What are we building down there again? Like, a hospital? A school for Mexicans? What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know, I thought it was like a gymnasium or...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why aren't they building it themselves?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They don't know how.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do we know how? I don't know how. You know how?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, Carla knows.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Carla knows. Oh, I feel like there were so many more people on this bus. There were, like, 200, 300 people before. Hey, Carla? Carla? Hi. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Oh, trying to sleep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is happening? Oh, God, what is happening?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you smell like a weird, warm cheese?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God, you know what? I'm gonna be in Mexico for my half-birthday.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And the Christmas party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And Cinco de Mayo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nah, no. We'll be back before that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we-No. You know how these things go. Construction projects, they say three months, and then, after two years, the lazy bums haven't even started. Now we're those lazy bums. I gotta get off this bus.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, guys, has anybody seen the baby?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Here's her carrier, but no Cece.

quotes.speaker: Jim's Dad
quotes.text: Jim, Jim, I want to give a toast. Where's the little girl of honor?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know, dad. I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: I don't mean to bug, but do you know when those subs are due into port? I got a hungry bunch of Mcphersons over there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. Hey, have you seen my baby?

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: I think maybe some blonde lady had her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A small blonde woman?

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: Smaller than me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, everyone? Everyone, can I just have your attention? Has anyone seen a small-[pointing to Angela] Stop that tiny blonde woman! She stole my baby!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [as Kevin runs to grab her] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [reaching into her purse] Give me the baby!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What? Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [holding the baby, walks up to Jim] Hi, honey. I was just changing the baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [baby voice] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walks up] Honey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Cece] Hi. [to everyone] All right. Travel safe, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did you think I stole your baby?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that? Oh, yeah, back then I did. Just now. So, don't, because I've got my eye on you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [gasping as he looks into Angela's purse] Look at these scones, Jim. Thousands of them. What kind of a person steals scones from a baby?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Someone put them in my bag.

quotes.speaker: Doug
quotes.text: [to Pam] So that was lunch, eh? Mcpherson troop, let's haul out. Rendezvous at Friendly's.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you lose Cece?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, a little bit. I did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you fake a seizure or a heart attack or something?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can make myself cry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do that. Do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Should I-I got it. I got it. [walks up to the bus driver] Um, hey, I saw a sign for a scenic overlook coming up. Really love to check out the view.

quotes.speaker: Bus driver
quotes.text: Can't stop. We're on a schedule.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, uh, there's a nice bistro coming up. We could pick up some Paninis for the road.

quotes.speaker: Bus driver
quotes.text: Maybe we'll stop in Tennesseee. It's not safe to talk to a driver.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [having walked up to the front] Okay, driver, driver, if you're not gonna stop this bus, then I'm going to stop it for you. Okay? Hang on. [pulls the string to request a stop, makes a dinging sound]

quotes.speaker: Bus driver
quotes.text: Stopping in Tennessee.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Hey, is there a problem, you guys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, just get him to stop the bus, please.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just make him stop the freaking bus!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop the bus, okay?

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Are you okay, sir?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't sign up for this. You guys are young, that's great. You want to give back to society. I've done that. I need to take.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: You have plenty left to give. You're doing-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blah-di-blah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We could go back and forth all day. It's not gonna solve anything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If we went to Mexico, we'd probably screw everything up anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want that for little Jessica? No, you don't. And the answer is clear. Stop the bus. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stop the bus!

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {andy}
quotes.text: [shouting and clapping] Stop the bus! Stop the bus!

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Okay, stop the dang bus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [bus stopping] Okay, well, a pleasure. Go save the world. We'll keep an eye on America for you.

quotes.speaker: Another guy
quotes.text: [getting off the bus] Wait for me! [bus drives away] Don't say anything to my parents.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [driving up to pick up Michael, Andy, and kid off the road] Get in quick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why quick?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So it's faster.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you guys want me to take you home or go back to the church?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is anyone still at the church?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, actually most of them went to go see a movie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. Kevin suggested it, and then they all went in Meredith's minivan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is so nice to be back in a country that has movies.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I bet. You guys.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Can I come? [silence]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, Lake Wobblegone's on. Do you guys-are you cool with that?

quotes.speaker: Radio
quotes.text: "... banana bread, but Fred Nordquist had no appetite. He was thinking about his pair of new boots. It'd been ten years after all. As he told Mrs. Nordquist, it would take two years to get comfortable with the new boots."
